intro: Elleanthus cordidactylus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed elleanthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and often aromatic foliage. The plant is distinguished by its linear, narrow leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
